answer:
1) FRAME‐BY‐FRAME ANALYSIS

• Frame 1:   
  – We see a wide, multi‐lane intersection with orange construction barrels to the far left (indicating a closure in that area).  
  – The white pickup is in the rightmost lane behind a white sedan. The painted arrow for that lane is not clearly visible yet.

• Frame 2:  
  – The pickup is still in the rightmost lane, and now the lane markings ahead show a large straight‐arrow in that lane (the arrow is pointed directly forward, not left).  
  – The dedicated left‐turn lane (left of the median) has its own left‐arrow marking, which the pickup is clearly not in.

• Frame 3:  
  – The pickup starts angling left across the crosswalk—yet it remains from that same rightmost “straight” lane. The traffic signals above appear to show red lights for through traffic (though the exact signal states aren’t fully clear, the key point is the pickup’s lane‐use markings on the pavement).

• Frame 4 and Frame 5:  
  – The pickup completes a left turn, crossing over all lanes from the right (straight‐only) lane instead of a left‐turn lane.  
  – There is no sign of it encountering any barricade or “road closed” area; rather, it seems to have simply turned left from the wrong lane.

2) CONTEXTUAL REASONING

Nothing in the frames suggests the white pickup ran a red light outright (the signals for its direction are not obviously showing a green, but the bigger violation shown is the lane usage). Also, the construction barrels are off to the left and do not obstruct the pickup’s path, so it is not driving through a closure. The clearly visible forward‐only arrow in Frame 2—and the subsequent left turn from that lane—is the salient illegal action.

3) MATCH TO ANSWER CHOICES

• (A) Ran a red light?  – The frames do not conclusively show it violating a red in terms of signal indication.  
• (B) Made a left turn from a straight‐only lane? – This aligns with the pavement arrows and the pickup’s path.  
• (C) Drove through a road closure?  – The truck does not appear to pass any barricades restricting its movement.  
• (D) Drove legally?  – The truck diverged from the lane’s designated flow.

4) BEST ANSWER

<answer>B. Yes it made a left turn from a straight only lane.</answer>
